website_summaries.verdict: Highly effective in some indoor applications yet can be pricey to operate and comes with some quirks including the potentially top-heavy design.
pros: Works in small to medium interior rooms by attracting insects to the UV light and keeping them in place with glue boards
Works well in areas where multiple insects such as flies tend to gather
cons: Plugs directly into outlets, and may be too heavy for some
Like similar models, replacing glue boards can get pricey
Some flickering of the light has been reported

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Please feast your eyes on the beginning of fly season this year! I have had this for a full year and love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kassie

customer_reviews.title: Saved my sanity!
customer_reviews.text: I have been fighting fruit flies for 3 weeks. Couldn't lay a drink down 3 seconds without one getting in it. Reallyyyy frustrating. Found this...figured it didn't hurt to try. Plugged it up as soon as it was delivered. I literally had to buy replacement cartridges the next day because it was FULL of fruit flies 10 hours later. I also bought another one a few days later for another part 2 of the house. It works!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tifany carter

customer_reviews.title: Great function, Rotten design
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great, make no mistakes, it catches all kinds of bugs, and you will be astounded by how many there actually are. I would give it five stars for performance. It loses a star because the unit is huge, takes up a lot of wall area space and trying to install it upside down so you can still use the entire outlet makes the card fall out (unless you secure it with a bobby pin, which is what I do, but that's annoying and not fail proof).
customer_reviews.author: Jenni M.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this product and company like a bug infestation
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of an older model of these about 3 years ago. They worked til they died. I had no complaints with the products. I bought 2 more to replace the old ones. One of the two is completely nonfunctional (50% success rate, right?). I tried to reach their customer service people for TWO WEEKS with no response whatsoever. I'm done with the company for good. Not sure if it's new ownership or just when the incompetence set in. Anyone can make a mistake, but when you don't care enough to respond to people, that's far and away your biggest problem. So, I am buying an entirely different product this time, and the dead one is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Piece Of Junk! Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Flyweb wall outlet, Very poor product, they should be ashamed of them self selling this product. $30 plus dollars! Buy Dynatrap! $19.99 and not one problem in a year. I bought Flyweb from Gardner, first one defective out of the box! video attached. Sent Gardner a email and they responded with we will send you a new one. Sent new one and it did the same thing. I sent a third request for a unit that just worked! They now have blown me off and am out $30. A ripe off, do not buy! FlyWeb Wall Outlet! Horrible customer service and I can not believe the box has "Made in USA sticker on the box.
customer_reviews.author: B+B Haag

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend! Pricey, but works!!
customer_reviews.text: Works amazingly well! It was really pricey as are the replacement glue traps, but well worth it! I cannot attest to the life of the product, but have had it for a month and it essentially grabs hold of any insect attracted to light (mosquitoes, flies, gnats, moths, etc.) Extremely pleased with this product and I hope it lasts a long time! I keep it in the kitchen leaving it on through the day and turning off all the lights at night and it endlessly works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie V.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Finally! something that catches bugs in my house!
customer_reviews.text: This is the end all for getting bugs around the house! I have tried many many other tricks for getting the bugs out of my house, but none of them worked well. This trap does the job for many different types of bugs too, which is great. I figured out how to use the large packs of yellow sticky pads sold at a much cheaper price by cutting them myself rather than paying an arm and a leg for the sticky pad replacements they sell for this. TLDR; works great, buy cheap off brand sticky pads and cut them yourself
customer_reviews.author: Beau Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Better off putting bait on the pad and sitting it out. The light is a waste of money. Bravo whoever created this POS and made money off of it. I have had the Fly Web Fly Trap out for two days, its caught maybe 4 flies. I took the Fly Web glue boards (separately ordered) and put pieces of food on them and left them by the window. The glue boards themselves caught the majority of the flies with one catching 12, another catching 7. Yet the thing I paid $30+ for sits there being an expensive night light that doesn't catch anything.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Wipes out those little gnats and flys
customer_reviews.text: I use it at work and at home. We have food service in our work kitchen and we have fruit flys and other gnats and small flying bugs. We can't just spray with insect repellant due to health risks. We use these instead and they work really well - especially overnight when they are one of few sources of light. I use them at home as well. Place it close to the kitchen and watch it work. It's a nightlight and efficient at wiping out what my dad used to call "no-see-em" bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Krusty

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, just use apple cider vinegar for gnats.  Way more effective
customer_reviews.text: I had a pretty bad gnat problem. I plugged this in where they were located. It did not catch a single gnat over night. Whereas my home made remedy of apple cider vinegar pretty much caught all of them.
customer_reviews.author: JHawk88

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was having a horrible time with house flies and fruit flies so after reading a few reviews I decided to purchase the Katchy Indoor Insect Trap. I was so desperate I decided to purchase 2. Thankfully before purchasing the second one I read a review that a gentlemen posted after trying several different indoor insect traps. The Katchy unit was rated #2. He had rated the Gardner Flyweb Classic Fly Light as #1. I decided to purchase one of each. I am so glad I did. I have had to change the Gardner units glue card almost daily while after 5 days I changed the Katchy one even though it wasn’t necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: It works great!!
customer_reviews.text: I too was skeptical about buying this bug trap. I had bought 2 others that looked similar, but were smaller and the light was bluer. Those didn't work at all at attracting and killing bugs. But this one does! I've already bought a pack of the refill sticky pads and my fruit fly and drain fly problem is gone. It's seriously big compared to the other bug lights, so be sure to find an electrical outlet that has enough clearance above it. It just barely fit under my kitchen cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: MtnGeekette

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, short lamp life...
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great since we got it a few months ago. Caught lots of bugs and easy to clean out. A few days ago it started blinking and my husband unplugged it. I’ve removed and reset the lamp (based on suggestions in the Q&A) but that didn’t work. So it appears that after only a few months of use, I need to replace the bulb, which is another $15. This isn’t a cheap unit and I would expect the bulb to last longer than 3 months. I will replace it, but if it dies again as quickly, I’m cutting my losses and this thing is going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: PMassey

customer_reviews.title: Effective Device
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic. After buying a bunch of bananas and leaving them out to ripen before freezing, I was overwhelmed with fruit flies! I was literally going to the car to eat so they wouldn't land on my food. I tried all the concoctions to attract them but would only catch one or two. After I received this device, I immediately noticed a decrease in the pests. It took about 5 days before they were completely gone. I highly recommend the product and it is totally worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Must continue to purchase refills
customer_reviews.text: This product has to be the biggest piece of junk on Amazon. Rather than a long rant let me just list the cons. 1: nothin else will fit into socket once this is plugged in. So if you are using outside and want more items that need power, forget it. 2: It needs to be refilled often which is additional cost each time you need to refill. ( about every other use). 3: When you are refilling bugs are going everywhere ESPECIALLY ALL OVER YOU! 4: Many other options that also provide a better lighting situation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution at a fair price!
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with small flies accumulating near the indoor wet cat food bowl and garbage can. It was a constant battle to control until I installed the Fly Web Fly Trap! I just installed this light/trap in an outlet near the problem source and it began working immediately... attracting and trapping the little pests on the sticky pad. Once the pad is over 50% filled, you simply just remove the old sticky pad and install a new one... very easy and economical! The light in the unit also serves as a nice night-light in the room. Great product... great company... perfect solution!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas L. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Works WONDERFULLY. and replacement paper is not too pricey
customer_reviews.text: This thing works GREAT! Living in an area with a bunch of farms, I have flies EVERYWHERE. Whenever I open my door we get gnats, flies as soon as we walk in. This thing has been up next to our door for about 3 months, and it has collected everything that has flown in. It is a blessing. Makes a great night light too
customer_reviews.author: fatguyinalilcoat

customer_reviews.title: What a wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I tried to find my original product review from 2017, that I added an update to the next year, but I couldn’t. This is my 2019 update. I still think it is wonderful. No work! No hassle! Put the fly trap glue pad on it, plug it in and that’s it. I’m into July 2019 now and just getting ready to change out the glue pad. I have recommended this to several, and they all say the same thing......”finally something that works without hassle”. It also makes a great nightlight in my kitchen. This is simply a great product that requires minimal human intervention.
customer_reviews.author: J I Means

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works. I've tried those moth traps and they're useless. I plugged in the Fly Web Trap and the next morning it was full of critters. I've had it going now for a week, and I don't see things flying about -- flies, moths, and little green things I've never noticed before until I found them stuck on the glue pad. I live in the city and when summer comes round, so do the flies -- even with windows screens. This is a terrific solution. No pesticides, or anything can harm pets. I move it from room to room and it works great. Turn off all the lights and leave this thing on overnight. You'll be amazed.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pena

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed so far
customer_reviews.text: Recently moved to an area surrounded by a horse farm ( read fly farm). The abundance of flies here is indescribable!! Desperate for some relief, I bought this with the promise of catching those buggers with ease. Alas, my handy dandy 1.95 fly swatter has had more success than this gadget. On the upside, I’m being sought by the Olympic fly swatting team. Flyswatter- 153- gadget - 0.
customer_reviews.author: jcvanch

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could give this 6 stars. Rain ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this 6 stars. Rain in California this year has caused the gnat population to explode. Home Depot is sold out of almost every possible solution.(Most of which don't work) The only close competitor was the apple cider vinegar and soap in a little plastic apple or peach thing. This blows all away. After eating Easter meal with gnats all over, I brought this device into the house. 2 hours later? See Attached Photo. Notes: You might want to buy extra glue paper and don't hang upside down as the glue paper will fall out after heating up.
customer_reviews.author: MattTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: As Amazon reviews become increasingly unreliable, I hope you will read this review knowing I genuinely used this product with no financial gain nor did I receive it at a discounted rate. It works. We have mosquitos visit our home and did not want to use chemicals/pesticides around our children. This has been a good way to minimize the presence of the bugs. Another bonus, it attracts little gnats/fruit flies as well. We keep it by the front door.
customer_reviews.author: sunnysparkie

customer_reviews.title: It quit working in less than 4 weeks!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so incredibly disappointed in this product. I plugged it in a few days after I received it and it quit working on Monday April 22nd 2019. So I got less than 1 month out of the product. It just quit working I tried to change outlets hoping that was the program unfortunately that’s not the case. I was so excited to have not only a product that plugged into the wall but also a bit smaller than the one downstairs. Unfortunately we’ve now wasted money on a product that was very expensive for the time it actually worked.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. We put it by our back door where the kids come in and out all day. Small gnats, flying insects are attracted to it. Always find something stuck to the paper in it. This is the second one we’ve bought. The first one lasted almost two years. It caught so many bugs that some fell down into the base where everything is connected and I think all those dead bugs in there might have “shorted”it out. Instead of buying the replacement bulb, we just bought another full plug in light. This unit also has refill papers that can be bought as well. This is a great bug lamp. We’ve recommended it to others.
customer_reviews.author: R A.

customer_reviews.title: Love These Buggers
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these when I started noticing a few small gnat-like bugs flying around our new home in Florida. Someone on our Nextdoor Community site suggested them. I no longer see the bugs flying around the house, but when I look, the traps definitely are catching the bugs. The light will cut off and on as needed to catch the bugs. I have not noticed any electric bill increase in the few months we’ve had them, and have had to replace the glue board only once so far. The light (which will likely be on if the room is dark) also does double duty as a night light.
customer_reviews.author: Donna W.

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these in my house. I am surrounded by cows on three sides and horses on the other. In the spring farmers spray with liquid manure. Need I say, I HAVE flies of all types and sizes. I live on a trout stream and during hatching days, small flies are thick. This fly trap gets 99%. A good old fly shatter gets the 1%. I have used for over 7 years. I’m getting a new one because the bulb blew out and I didn’t want to change the bulb. I have changed the bulb in the past and it’s easy but can be messy with all the fly carcasses.
customer_reviews.author: ridge runner

customer_reviews.title: Does its job- Works best at Night
customer_reviews.text: This works fairly well. It works much better at night, as during the day all the critters just fly to the windows instead. I don’t think it catches anything during the day inside, but each time we wake up there are more in there. Has def reduced the amount of flies/bugs! Glue works really well on the sticky sheets, haven’t had a problem with anything getting loose. Nice that the unit/light doesn’t give off a lot of heat. It is very large and bulky, so do keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Kensie

customer_reviews.title: No Longer Annoyed by Gnats
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be the summer of the gnat, so I needed a solution- this is working awesome! It is also catching flies and even a grasshopper! I wouldn’t recommend it for flies, as not all of them are attracted to it, but the little bugs definitely go right to it. I already bought a second one for my mom, after she mentioned gnat issues.
customer_reviews.author: T-View

customer_reviews.title: Best fly catcher - no touch on stick or ick
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome.. no more fly swatted smashed bugs that you have to clean off windows.. the light attracts them and they stick-pull out no touch by the flies and throw them away.. I bought a second one for the back room.. love them..... The inserts have stick only in the centers so they do not stick in the side and there is a top Finger hold with no stick.. I thought I might need gloves but did not..
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Too big and bulky.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought 3 of these in the last 6 months. Two from amazon and one from the manufacturer. The two from amazon have worked great. The friends who own them love them. The one from the manufacturer is the PITS. I’ve attached a video to see what it does. It will not stay in any of my outlets. Too big and heavy. Not feasible to send back as I would have to pay for shipping plus a 30% restocking fee. My loss. But will not buy the Fly Trap brand again. If I had only bought the bad one I would have put one star.
customer_reviews.author: SHARON L

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Safe, and Very Effective
customer_reviews.text: We had large flies in a basement area, and now we don't! It's doing fairly well with the fruit flies too. I realized after I purchased this that it was similar to a flea trap that we had years ago. The combination of light and a glue board is very effective, and the light here is much better than it was on that earlier item. I am very pleased with this especially because most of the fly trap item sold on Amazon are not safe for indoor use. This one is, and you could use it anywhere in your house. No, it's not the cheapest item of its kind. But it really does work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Insect Trap I Own
customer_reviews.text: The problem with most insect traps is that they have a specific sized insect in mind. With this thing, it doesn't matter if you are trying to trap gnats, mosquittoes, flies, moths, etc. The light attracts them and the glue makes sure it doesn't get away. I use it at night and it's usually the only light on in the room. This ensures it is the light that will attract the insects, the brighter the other lights in the room the less effective.
customer_reviews.author: Nyota Uhura

customer_reviews.title: Catches all manner of flying insects
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for several years and it works as advertised. In fact, the thing caught a wasp the other day. Yes, I've had to replace the bulbs every few years but other than replacing the sticky paper, that's about it. Frankly, I'm astounded by the negative reviews, because it works. But i suppose anyone can get a defective one. Before anyone asks, i don't work for the company.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: The Sticky Board is the Killer
customer_reviews.text: I got this unit today, placed it in my kitchen for an hour and it cleaned out 14 flies. But I was blindsided by the ongoing costs. The glue boards are the killers. The instructions say that a glue board will hold about 100 flies. The boards are sold in boxes of 10 for $15. That's 1,000 flies for $15 or $.02 per fly. It doesn't make sense to pay $30+ for the unit and 1.50 for each board thereafter. A zapper unit would be much cheaper in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Juridicus

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well
customer_reviews.text: This does not work well as a fly trap. A couple of flies did get stuck on it, but by and large the flies ignore it. I feel like this was a complete waste of money. As a note, if you want to catch moths, moths are drawn to it. A couple of moths got into the house and we quickly drawn to the light and stuck in the trap. However, the "moth dust" from their wings got all over the trap and quickly coated all of the sticky stuff so the trap is done now.
customer_reviews.author: Jegan

customer_reviews.title: Effective bug catcher
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the FlyWeb Classic Fly Light to help control the fungus gnat problem that resulted from our houseplant soil. It works great to catch these annoying insects, and BONUS, any other flying insects that find their way into our home! It's so simple to use, and the super sticky glue strips are easy to replace when they get too full, so I recommend getting a pack of the replacement sheets. Great product. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Tara P.

customer_reviews.title: Catches flies and fruit flies.... eventually
customer_reviews.text: Its SUPER bright so dont think you are going to sleep near it or anything. Oh its also really large as well I figured from the pictures it would be 4-6" tall but its like 12" tall and 4" wide! I could probably use it as a fly swatter too. Flies may take a while to get caught (I sat here and watched one sit on the edge of one of the triangles for about 10 min before he finally flew into the sticky paper.
customer_reviews.author: Shinobi

customer_reviews.title: Winter Cluster Fly Buster
customer_reviews.text: This nifty little lamp does the trick. Already assembled minus the sticky card upon arrival. Every winter we get 10-20 cluster flies (large sluggish flies not interested in food or trash-only in light) per day from the attic; where they have been since before the home was bought. It caught three within minutes. Even with otherwise bright daylight 90W LED bulbs in a light fixture above; they head right for the lamp. At night it catches the few remaining stragglers and in the morning those who emerge for the day. The only slight difficulty is the tube starter can be a bit slow to kick over when cold. Two pronged plug with room below for a lower outlet use.
customer_reviews.author: John J

customer_reviews.title: Worth Buying!
customer_reviews.text: The Gadner FlyWeb Classic Fly Light is awesome and worth buying! My husband and myself are very happy with the Gardner FlyWeb Fly Light, as it as attracts many flies and nats. Note, that it will attract the flies and nats better if it is placed away from other lights that somewhat hender the light from attracting.
customer_reviews.author: BeeBee

customer_reviews.title: Great light and actually works!
customer_reviews.text: This catches tons of flies that enter the kitchen thru garage. Once I notice flies in the garage, I turn off the garage light and they immediately fly to the light even though it’s a good distance from the smelly garbage can and litter boxes. We live in Texas so bugs can get out of control. It’s a bit expensive, but worth it to avoid the nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Absolutly great. Within about 10 minutes of plugging this in we had caught several fruit flys. We live in florida and deal with them alot. I didn't even realize how many we had until this started catching them. We installed it behind our garbage can in the kitchen. I do wish it had an on /off switch because we turn it off at night, I can not stand any light on at night. We put the plug on a switch which solved the problem for us otherwise it is unplugging it every night but for how well it works it's would be worth it. It would be nice if it included a couple of replacement pads too.
customer_reviews.author: D. Roclevitch

customer_reviews.title: It's like the bugs are actively trying to die
customer_reviews.text: This thing works fantastically! I've had one for about 5 years now and I'm always amused by just how efficient this little thing is. It creates a noticeable difference in the bug population of your house. It's like the bugs are actively trying to die. Within a week of bringing it out after a few weeks of not using it, the sticky sheet is covered in bugs. Within a month, it's literally coated in bugs. Catches bugs of all sizes, too, from the tiny fruit flies to obnoxiously large spiders. This is just a well-made and well-designed product that should be in every home and office.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell C. Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Surprise!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I was quite surprised at how effective this thing is. We get a fly or two in the house just about every day and they can be quite irritating. Seems like every time they buzz around the fly swatter is on the other side of the room and they've run off again by the time we get it. This fly trap often gets them before we even notice they're in the house! When we first plugged it in, I thought we had gone a couple days with no flies for some reason, but when I looked there were five flies stuck on the pad. I might add it's somewhat emotionally satisfying seeing the little irritants stuck there. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! We've had a big problem with flies and mosquitos here for the last couple of years. Figured out that I need to keep this near my fruit basket in the kitchen or they get unbearable. This light is a little icky looking but works great. I make sure to change out the sticky pad for a clean one when guests come over so that they do t get grossed out. Otherwise one pad lasts us about two to three weeks. We live in Southern California so we don't have a ton of humidity or rain. If you live somewhere where there are a ton more bugs you might want one for every room in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Connie ThomasTop Contributor: Cake Decorating

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as described!
customer_reviews.text: What a terrible thing to have to purchase something like this. Had a short period where we had a problem last summer where we had a bunch of houseflies in our home due to a vacation where some garbage got left unattended. For a few weeks we were finding and swatting flies on a daily basis. Got this product and plugged it in and we were not disappointed. Exactly as advertised, the device attracted dozens of flies and we were able to get rid of this pesky problem once and for all!
customer_reviews.author: Len Fredrickson

customer_reviews.title: Very effective but poor quality manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: We purchased one of these Fly Web units on Sept 17 through Amazon. For the few weeks that it worked it attracted gnats and drain flies like crazy. (a good thing!) However, a couple of days ago it started flickering and now it's so bad I have had to unplug it because the flickering was giving anyone in the same room headaches. The one I had before did the same thing after a year of use. If I had gotten that much use out of this new one I'd be happy, but only 3 weeks is not really what I would consider an acceptable lifespan. Not worth spending $$ on
customer_reviews.author: BDill

customer_reviews.title: The Mighty Lil Fly Killer
customer_reviews.text: This things works like a champ. Bought it in 2017 and I only plug it in when the flies and gnats peak in the spring/summer in north Texas and I only use it during the daytime cause that light it bright. This approach may have helped the lightbulb last this long. Just change out the sticky paper when it fills up. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TexRex

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't attracted house flies
customer_reviews.text: The product has attracted lots of gnats and a few other small insects, but no house flies --- our reason for purchase. We've tried a few locations in and around the kitchen, and in varying lighting conditions. Can not recommend at this time.
customer_reviews.author: dmk

customer_reviews.title: works well and can be used as a night light too
customer_reviews.text: It does well at attracting flies in the house and they get stuck to the paper behind the light. In our house it works better than the traditional fly traps that come in a spool and you pull it out to reveal a long sticky strip which you hang from the ceiling. It doubles as a decent night light as well, if you keep it plugged in at night. We keep ours plugged in 24/7 and have caught 8 flies in 1 month! I had no idea we had so many hanging around to catch. We have not yet had to buy the replacement paper, but will soon get some off amazon as well.
customer_reviews.author: AV

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this thing plugged in next to our Kitchen counter for 3 years now, and literally hundreds of insects have met their demise in it. Been through almost 30 of the Glue Boards since purchasing. Eliminated tons of fruit flies and other tiny insects that are abundant here in the desert, as well as some regular flies and even an occasional moth or beetle. Bonus... it works as a Night Light as well!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Biggs

customer_reviews.title: Sticky Light, Sticky Night!
customer_reviews.text: This product works really well! During the summer, the gnats can get out of control depending on what we put in our trash can. Leaving this on over night attracts gnats, and sends them off to gnat heaven (or hell). It also proves to be a great night light. When I first got this, I had to reseat the light as it was flickering, but afterwards it has been working very well. The pad is very sticky, I wouldn't recommend putting your finger on it.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected!
customer_reviews.text: Within an hour it had a fruit fly and a traditional house fly. Sold! I did underestimate the size - this thing is huge. Also, it's a real bummer that it only comes w/ 1 sticky pad. For this price you'd think it'd come w/ at least 5. Also it does have a loud humming noise which is a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Greta Claire

customer_reviews.title: Sanity Saver!
customer_reviews.text: Every fall we get these little flies that are slighter larger than gnats but smaller than fruit flies. They drove me crazy! And I didn't want to use pesticides. This thing is a sanity-saver. Catches them like crazy. I put 3 downstairs and 3 upstairs, but not in bedrooms because they are too bright to sleep near. They also catch any mosquitoes or small moths that might get in, and the occasional house fly as well. Not sure they'd work if you have a big house-fly problem, but for the little buggers there's nothing better!
customer_reviews.author: Nipper's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Works but a problem with structure
customer_reviews.text: well it works. i have had this for a couple of years and it is on 24 7. the problem is the glueboard melt and makes a mess inside (well not just glue- glue with dead bugs) and there is no way to clear them out... the glue should be more concentrated so it doesnt touch the unit itself...
customer_reviews.author: Thegrove

customer_reviews.title: Lord of the Flies!
customer_reviews.text: OMG this thing really works! We get flies in the house off & on depending on the weather. Its our fault, we leave the back door open so the dogs can go in/out when the weather is nice, but then the house is inundated with flies. We've tried many solutions before but nothing was as effective as this light. Within 1 day the house is clear of flies and the glue board shows the evidence. We've learned to unplug it when not really needed so the light lasts longer. At first we left it on 24/7 and the bulb gave out at around 45 days. Now whenever we see a fly buzzing around, we plug it in for a day.
customer_reviews.author: Just Love Dogs

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bill
customer_reviews.text: We were in serious need of house fly solutions, so in the day time I would do my best to suck them up w/ a vacuum. If I missed any I would plug this in at night, and the flies and everything else would be lured to the light. It's worked for me everytime. My only complaint is that I think it would benefit from a third prong. It's a little heavy just to be 2 pronged. I believe I saw similar reviews saying as much before I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Served its purpose
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for our bug problem. The only thing is that it heats up and it’s hot when you remove it for the plug. Also it only came with one adhesive which I wish it had more. Not sure if there’s a way to order more. Other than it gets hot leaving it in the wall to long the product worked great.
customer_reviews.author: brandi kim

customer_reviews.title: Stop debating and buy...Its worth it
customer_reviews.text: This product solved my fly problem with out the option of the smell of rotten meat or chasing flies all day with a nasty swatter. It is bigger than expected but it works. The picture shows that it killed flies, spiders and anything that came in contact with the sticky pad. I will buy another if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Niqmo1

customer_reviews.title: Works! Solved our problem
customer_reviews.text: Great product! We had an unsolvable random big ugly black fly issue. Anywhere from 1 to 4 huge flys would appear in the house almost every day. Seemingly out of nowhere. Put the light up near our back door and it’s been killing tiny little flies ever since. Obviously there must be an issue with the back door not closing 100% but this did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Venetia

customer_reviews.title: Been working great since 2015
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when we moved next to a dairy farm that had more flies than I’d ever seen. Everytime we opened the door we would get at least 5-6 flys in the house. I’ve had this plugged in my kitchen and when I wake up the flies are all stuck on the glue paper. No more hunting them down with the fly swatter. Also works great on the gnats too. Bought it in 2015 and it’s still running off of the original bulb. I’m going to by one for the garage next.
customer_reviews.author: it sounds good on paper

customer_reviews.title: Great insect trapper
customer_reviews.text: I didn't really believe this would work but it has trapped fruit flies that would otherwise be bothering us. It's kind of fascinating to see the dead insects. It's easy to use, just replace the sticky paper. I would recommend this for mild cases of indoor insect infestation.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Death Star!
customer_reviews.text: This this is amazing! I was VERY skeptical especially for the price. But the first night it killed so many bugs. It stole all the thunder from our other bug traps. I’ve now ordered one for my friend in Germany and more for other rooms in my house
customer_reviews.author: Jaci

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, I always have one fly flying around my house. Fly spray now only disables them for a brief time. You can buy the bug-a-salt, which works, however you'll also have salt all over you house. So, after getting fed up with spending to chase the fly around with fly spray one evening. I went through amazon to find something that would catch flies and came across this device. It got delivered today and I plugged it in. Less than three hours it catch the fly. 5 Stars. Note: It only comes with one sticky pad. Make sure you buy a refill pack.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Product Didn't Work For Me
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work for me. Many flies were in the room but not in the trap. The trap was located in a small bathroom. I left the product there for several weeks in order to allow sufficient time to see the results. I have also used flypaper. The flypaper caught many more flies but it is ugly and obtrusive. I was looking for a better solution but unfortunately this product was not it.
customer_reviews.author: sara1

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: So I've never been a mosquito person, however this light as well as fly trap is absolutely need to buy. I had one for years and recently the bulb blew out so while buying a bulb I ended up buying 2 more of these for each entry way into the house and one for our kitchen and I absolutely love these. Like genuinely, my first time ever writing a product review, but if you're debating between these and something cheaper, you have to pick these over the cheaper ones. These are long time use, friendly to use, and the adhesions 10 pack along with these will last you a long time.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Patel

customer_reviews.title: Highly Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I’m a moron by not not first removing film off tack paper. It now works as advertised. Only concern is it’s size and its brightness indoors. Old review: Ineffective. I've been using it for the past 2wks and it hasn't caught anything. In fact, flies and other insects tend to avoid it. Complete waste of $50.
customer_reviews.author: UPDATED (09/20): Humble Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Does not catch houseflies
customer_reviews.text: I have the unit in a spare bathroom with the cat's food and litter box. No windows or competing light. Plenty of houseflies. The unit has run for a week, and only caught a few small flies like fruit flies. The regular houseflies fly around it like it doesn't exist. In contrast, the sticky fly strip I had used previously caught several houseflies in the same amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the fly killer I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Philthy rEviewS....the quiet blue light that catches flies.... I say...click to buy but.....it depends on the flies.... I left it on the nights flies snuck in through open doors etc....but I never really caught much. They must breed smarter flies where I live. I would catch other flying insects but the flies were hit or miss. Again I always say your mileage may vary. It could work for you but it wasn't quite so successful for me.
customer_reviews.author: Philthy G

customer_reviews.title: This works well.
customer_reviews.text: This works well enough where I bought a second one. One is in the kitchen and it catches a lot of different insects ranging from flies to moths to other insects. The second one is in the basement and that one has caught mostly tiny little little flying insects (gnats, I think). I replaced the bulb on the first one after a few years. This is one of the better traps except for maybe our indoor zapper. One would think that we have an insect problem given all these traps/zapper. LOL. I just can't stand flying insects at all.
customer_reviews.author: TheTruth

customer_reviews.title: very effective product,and good night light
customer_reviews.text: this is my 3rd fly trap. the first one used it for 4 years until I accidentally knocked it over and broke it. the bulb lasts more than a year I guess depends how often you are moving it. this works well trapping small insects specially gnats. fly doesn't die instantly most of the time hear it flapping around their wings trying to get out of that sticky paper, that's the only annoying part of it. i love this product even the waxed paper kinda expensive but better than constant buying for bug spray that most of the time missed anyway since they are too fast lol.
customer_reviews.author: golda

customer_reviews.title: Annoyingly bright, but effective.
customer_reviews.text: Went on a smoothie kick, and we wound up with fruit flies. I HATE fruit flies. You could have two, and the darn things just HAVE to buzz in your face. Don't know if it's my perpetual use of lip balm (usually fruit flavored) but it drove me nuts. This wasn't cheap, but it had good reviews, so I decided to give it a go. I just placed it for a day or two in whatever room I found fruit flies (there were one or two in the home office and bedroom, too), and soon enough I'd find their little bodies stuck to the film. Within a week, no more flying pests of any kind upstairs or down.
customer_reviews.author: Z.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Does it work? Yes! I have tow, one upstairs in the hall and one downstairs in the kitchen. I originally got one for kitchen flies. I hate flies, my husband and dogs hate it when I run around with a fly swatter. It worked so well for flies I got another one this summer for the upstairs. Cooking and eating on the deck almost everyday is great, but a lot of bugs get in the house. In the summertime I replace the sticky insert every few days because it is literally covered in bugs. They also make great nightlights. The photo is of a two-day old strip from the upstairs hallway light.
customer_reviews.author: PAT

customer_reviews.title: This Bug Trap Works
customer_reviews.text: Oh wow this works. It worked by attracting all the flies and bugs in the house to the blue light that it emits and then catches the bugs in fly paper strips. You have to change the strips every once in a while. It caught a ton of bugs so far. My only complaints are that it is rather large and I thought I had ordered a white trap but ended up with a gray/beige color, which I don't care for as much. Finally, it emits a blue light, which was so bright in my tiny house. I had to move it to an area far from the entrance to my bedroom to avoid nighttime light pollution.
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve W

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work on fruit flies, and the bulb burned out in a week. Overpriced considering it's really just a plug in fluorescent with a slot for fly paper.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo

customer_reviews.title: It really works!!
customer_reviews.text: I hate bugs. So a few years ago I purchased this hoping that maybe it would help out catching the random flying critters that entered my home. I think I bought this 4 years ago and have only replaced the bulb once. It is constantly plugged in and the light is on 24/7. This thing catches everything from tiny gnats and moths to regular house flies. I'm always amazed when I change the sticky pad by the variety and quantity of bugs this thing has attracted. I just changed the sticky card this morning and I found my self amazed how long this has been working and how effective its been. It really works!
customer_reviews.author: C21Kristin

customer_reviews.title: This trap is working well for us
customer_reviews.text: This trap worked within minutes. I have three south facing windows in a small barndominium, always full of flies. I put the trap in a corner on the same wall away from the windows and went outside. When we returned a couple of hours later the trap had already caught a half dozen or so flies. I was very pleased. We left it plugged in for a couple of days and it filled the pad, but now unplug it when we are not there, even though the instructions say 24/7, we are just not comfortable leaving a light on when we are not there every day.
customer_reviews.author: cbourne

customer_reviews.title: Trouble-free way to deal with flying pests
customer_reviews.text: Mine are white, not beige as they appear in the photo. Great product. I have two of these and catch all sorts of flying creatures in them, effortlessly and without mess. Buy the fly trap once, and you only have to replace the glue cards periodically. I bought my first one when I lived in another state, and I had it on continuously for two years before I had to replace the light in it. Neither light nor glue boards are very expensive, so I consider this a great way to deal with fruit flies, houseflies, mosquitoes, or whatever other insects plague a house.
customer_reviews.author: Merica Saint John

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing I have ever bought! I have referred family to buy these as well! I bought one and have it in my kitchen/dinning room area. My house is 2000 sq feet and seems so to do well. I will be buying another one. Also you will want to buy the sticky pads that go with it as it only comes with one.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastically!
customer_reviews.text: Set all the review were’s saying flies are not attracted to light this it does work for houseflies! We just moved into a new home and the door was open all day with movers in and out. So many flies came in, ordered this and plugged in when it arrived. Less than an hour later already has 2 large flies stuck along with many smaller flying insects. Absolutely works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Je Lo

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for fruit flies
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work for me. Had an infestation of fruit flies around my sink and bought this to help control it. After a week plugged in directly next to the sink it only caught three. Obviously doesn’t work for this kind of problem. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Catherine Lombardo

customer_reviews.title: Somehow it got rid of drain flys.
customer_reviews.text: I got this thing to deal with a drain fly problem I had. After about 1 week I don't see them anymore. I didn't even expect it to get rid of the problem I just wanted to make the flys go to the light in a different room so they weren't bothering me at least. But like I said after about 1 week of this thing plugged into the wall in a bathroom the drain flys are completely gone.
customer_reviews.author: Review

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: These do actually do a great job of controlling gnat and flies,we use 3 of them in our garage/mudroom .They head off most of the bugs before they can get into the house. We've used them for years,I think the secret to success on these is that it needs to be dark in the room with this as the only light source. The pic is of one in mudroom / back porch next to where we keep trash can.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Somehow a couple of house flies got into my apartment this summer and the next thing I knew they were EVERYWHERE! Because of my pets I wanted something non-toxic and reusable. This fit the bill. It started attracting and catching flies within a minute of being plugged in and caught them even with competing light sources on at the same time. Works like a charm. Advantages are: 1 - Non-toxic 2 - Easy to use 3 - Works extremely well 4 - Can be moved from room to room 5 - No buzzing sound every time a fly I caught So far, haven't encountered any disadvantages.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Schneller

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw .. but great concept
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to put this in the place I find fruit flies and flies the most....The kitchen. The design is a little flawed which may be my cabinets but even plugging it in the bottom outlet the left top corner of it with it having a slope wouldn’t allow it to be used in the kitchen. It intersected with the bottom of my cabinets and made the light hang out of the outlet. If the designed was fixed I think this thing would be unstoppable.
customer_reviews.author: sherri

customer_reviews.title: Effective, but not a total solution.
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these running 24/7 in opposite ends of the house for over a week.. The housefly infestation has been significantly reduced, but not eliminated. There are still a few buzzing around. I'd estimate a 90% reduction. I'd call this an effective device, but certainly not a panacea.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Beats any home remedy!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great! Just got it and it started trapping gnats 10 minutes after I plugged it in! Just ordered replacements for the insert so I have them. Going to give it a week or two and will probably order another one. Highly recommend this product! Update - After several weeks, it is still filling up with gnats. Therein lies the problem. It does not get rid of the gnats, only controls them. This should be used in conjunction with sprays or foggers. Dropping a star from my review for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: Donatello

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Bulb lasted 2 years 24/7 use. Attracts the bugs
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the same fly trap for 2 years. The original bulb lasted 2 years. The tape does a good job trapping all kinds of bugs. The replacement strips and bulbs are easy to replace and not messy.
customer_reviews.author: Isaias A.

customer_reviews.title: Works In a Farm House
customer_reviews.text: We live on a farm so the bugs are plentiful, always getting in the house. This thing has been awesome! It has caught flies, mosquitoes, gnats, fruit flies, and even stink bugs! A huge improvement on the sticky tape that we used to hang all over the house. This thing attracts them. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Bubbles

customer_reviews.title: Returned This to Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely useless. Didn’t trap not one fruit fly. Save your money. Purchased four products from Amazon to use to get rid of fruit flies. The only thing that did work was the Fly Web Glue boards. They work and I ordered them more than once to place in the pot of my house plants. Do not buy this expensive light that goes with the board. The $39 light was returned to Amazon because it didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: EP

customer_reviews.title: The most effective fly trap I've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible! I live in a rural area near the woods and all sorts of flying bugs of all sizes get in during the day as we come and go. This thing is a magnet for them! I ended up getting two. The glue boards are super sticky and easy to swap out.
customer_reviews.author: Cody L.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: So pleased it caught five flies in one day... without any work from me!
customer_reviews.text: I put it in yesterday morning, and it already caught five flies! Sooo pleased that I didn’t have to do anything to catch flies, but will have to purchase the glue paper separately, as noted in other reviews, only one is included, and remember to change the glue paper. The fluorescent light is very bright in the dark, but I guess that’s how it attracts the flies from other light sources. I put it in a room down low out of the way and it still got flies! Got this because of the Wirecutter review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon user

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but...
customer_reviews.text: Love the product. Works great. Bulb already went out after 5 months. Between the replacement pads and the light bulbs every 5 months get ready for a 100$ a year expense. We have really bad flys here because of the rain and no winters. I replace the pad every week. Now a bulb every 5 months... works great, just know the (kind of hidden) expense will add up quickly. Again, works great...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.text: It didn't attract a single thing. To see flies be within a foot of it and nothing was the final straw. We used it for a matter of days and then sent it back. Maybe in a different setting it works but not inside a retail store with a fly problem coming from our open door.
customer_reviews.author: Christine F.

customer_reviews.title: It actually works
customer_reviews.text: This is great for gnats, moths, etc. I did not think this was gonna work but it actually does. I plugged it in at night and the gnats are attracted to it. We even caught a moth. Update: I bought a second one in my garage. It has caught flies, gnats and other insects consistently. This has been a life saver. It really helps.
customer_reviews.author: Marvel Mom

customer_reviews.title: It works but stingy with the sticky pads...
customer_reviews.text: This products works great! This year flies and gnats have been terrible. I had to get something to help with it. Con: for the price of this product, you would think it would have a 10 pack of sticky pads or at least 5. But it only comes with one 👀. That was annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Impressed So Far...
customer_reviews.text: Got this a few days ago and it does work! I was having a fly problem, but didn't want chemicals or sounds because of pets. Plugged it right in and no more random flies! Super easy to put together and easy to use. Just hoping that finding the replacement pads will be just as easy...
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: I had this setup in my kitchen where we’ve been having some flies sneaking in thru the terrace door. 2 or three flies and this thing captured none in 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Salem

customer_reviews.title: works but overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well for the little flies. The big flies not so much. It is extremely bright. Sadly it's over priced for what amounts to a lamp and some glue and paper. Update april 2020. Light is still bright. Still works very well for the tiny fliers. Zero luck after 3 years with anything approaching a house fly size though.
customer_reviews.author: tntricia

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I wish the glue board was better hidden
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I wish the glue board was better hidden. Kinda gross with the bugs exposed and I don't replace the glue board for just a few bugs obviously because I don't want to buy glue boards every week. Make sure you peel the safety sheet off the glue board lol. I had plugged in a couple days thinking it didn't work before I realized there was a sheet covering the glue.
customer_reviews.author: DarlDDD

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it is an ornament or a tool...
customer_reviews.text: Practical as a night light, but as far as catching flies, zero, nada, zilch, nothing. The buzzers are merrily flying around it, slamming against the window glasses and ignoring it. It did not catch a single fly in more than a week. It did not even catch a mosquito or any other flying insect, to be fair. This thing is just a large overpriced blue light.
customer_reviews.author: Alessandro Catorcini

product_meta.title: Gardner FlyWeb Classic Fly Light – Attract and Trap Flying Insects – Plugs into Outlet – Non-Toxic Glueboard – Great for Homes, Kitchens, Bedrooms, Offices, Workspaces – 9 Watt UV – Made in USA
product_meta.description:
The FlyWeb Classic is designed for indoor use wherever there are flying pests. Flying insects are drawn to the energy-efficient, 9 watt U.V. light and trapped on the web-like adhesive glue card. The compact size makes it perfect to hide while ridding your space of flying pests. The Flyweb Classic is perfect for use in the home around the kitchen, bars, restaurants, office spaces, breakrooms, etc. Remove the protective coating on the adhesive board, insert it into the unit and the trap is set. All you need is an electrical outlet – just plug it in!

- 24 Hour, non-chemical silent trapping
- Color is a off white finish
- One Disposable 3x5 inch adhesive panel
- Covers 600 sq. ft.(20 lineal feet)
- 9 watts of Ultra Violet Insect Attraction
- UL-CUL listed - 115v-60hz, direct plug-in
- FDA & USDA accepted under current code
- Dimensions: 3.5 in W x 10.5in H x 1.75in D
feature_bullets: JUST PLUG IT IN (PATENTED DESIGN): Simply plug the FlyWeb Fly Light into any standard electrical outlet - Gardner Manufacturing holds the patent for the only direct plug-in insect light trap (Patent # 6,886,292
EFFECTIVE INSECT CONTROL: The FlyWeb Classic is designed for indoor use wherever there are flying pests – homes, offices, bedrooms, kitchens, hallways, RVs, etc

SAFE AND EASY TO USE: Once plugged in the fly light emits a warm UV light to attract flying insects of all kinds – it then captures the pests on a non-toxic glueboard adhesive which easily slides out for simple disposal and replacement
MADE IN THE USA: Gardner has been a trusted USA manufacturer since 1928 - all products accepted by the USDA, FDA and recommended by health inspectors

REPLACEMENT LAMPS AND GLUEBOARDS: For the Flyweb Classic to maintain its maximum effectiveness it is recommended that you replace the glueboards (Part Number EL-64 or EL-65) monthly and replace the UV Insect Lamp (Part Number EL-22) annually

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,829 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
